types

Class ClassType

  • java.lang.Object
    • types.Type
      • types.ComparableType
        • types.ReferenceType
          • types.ClassType

  • public final class ClassType
extends ReferenceType
    The type of a class.
    Author:
    Fausto Spoto

      • canBeAssignedTo

        public final boolean canBeAssignedTo(Type other)
        Determines whether this class type can be assigned to a given type. The latter must be a class type, and it must be a (non-necessarily strict) superclass of this class.
        Specified by:
        canBeAssignedTo in class Type
        Parameters:
        other - what this class should be assigned to
        Returns:
        true if the assignment is possible, false otherwise

      • subclass

        public boolean subclass(ClassType other)
        Checks if this class is a (non-necessarily strict) subclass of another.
        Parameters:
        other - the other class
        Returns:
        true if this class is a (non-necessarily strict) subclass of other, false otherwise

      • leastCommonSupertype

        public Type leastCommonSupertype(Type other)
        Computes the least common supertype of a given type and this class type. That is, a common supertype which is the least amongst all possible supertypes.
        • If other is an array type, then Object is returned;
        • Otherwise, if other is a class type then the least common superclass of this and other is returned;
        • Otherwise, if other is a NilType or an UnusedType, then this is returned;
        • Otherwise, null is returned.
        Overrides:
        leastCommonSupertype in class Type
        Parameters:
        other - the type whose least supertype with this class must be found
        Returns:
        the least common supertype of this class and other, if it exists, null otherwise (for instance, there is no least common supertype between int and any class type)

      • getInstances

        public final java.util.List<ClassType> getInstances()
        Yields the set of strict and non-strict, direct and indirect subclasses of this class.
        Returns:
        the set of strict and non-strict, direct and indirect subclasses of this class. This list is never empty since this class is always an instance of itself

      • fieldLookup

        public final FieldSignature fieldLookup(java.lang.String name)
        Looks up from this class for the signature of the field with the given name, if any.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the field to look up for
        Returns:
        the signature of the field, as defined in this class or in one of its superclasses. Yields null if no such field has been found

      • constructorsLookup

        public final java.util.Set<ConstructorSignature> constructorsLookup(TypeList formals)
        Looks up in this class for the signatures of all constructors with parameters types compatible with those provided, if any. It is guaranteed that in the resulting set no constructor signature is more specific than another, that is, they are not comparable.
        Parameters:
        formals - the types the formal parameters of the constructors should be more general of
        Returns:
        the signatures of the resulting constructors. Returns an empty set if no constructor has been found

      • constructorLookup

        public ConstructorSignature constructorLookup(TypeList formals)
        Looks up in this class for the signature of the constructor with exactly the given parameters types, if any.
        Parameters:
        formals - the types of the formal parameters of the constructor
        Returns:
        the signature of the constructor, as defined in this class. Yields null if no such constructor has been found

      • methodLookup

        public final MethodSignature methodLookup(java.lang.String name,
                                          TypeList formals)
        Looks up from this class for the signature of the method with exactly the given name and parameters types, if any.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the method to look up for
        formals - the types of the formal parameters of the method
        Returns:
        the signature of the method, as defined in this class or in one of its superclasses. Yields null if no such method has been found

      • methodsLookup

        public final java.util.Set<MethodSignature> methodsLookup(java.lang.String name,
                                                          TypeList formals)
        Looks up from this class for the signatures of all methods with the given name and parameters types compatible with those provided, if any. It is guaranteed that in the resulting set no method signature is more specific than another, that is, they are not comparable.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the method to look up for
        formals - the types the formal parameters of the methods should be more general of
        Returns:
        the signatures of the resulting methods. Returns an empty set if no method has been found

      • toBCEL

        public final org.apache.bcel.generic.Type toBCEL()
        Translates a Kitten type into its BCEL equivalent. It generates an org.apache.bcel.generic.ObjectType for the name of this class. For String, it generates one for runTime.String.
        Specified by:
        toBCEL in class Type
        Returns:
        the BCEL type corresponding to this Kitten type

      • mk

        public static ClassType mk(java.lang.String name)
        Yields a class type with the given name. If a class type object named name already exists, that object is returned. Otherwise, if a Kitten class named name.kit exists and contains no error, a KittenClassType is returned. Otherwise, a fictitious KittenClassType is returned, whose code has no fields nor constructors nor methods.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the class
        Returns:
        the unique class type object for the class with the given name

      • mkFromFileName

        public static ClassType mkFromFileName(java.lang.String fileName)
        Yields a class type with the given file name. If a class type object with this name already exists, that object is returned. Otherwise, if a Kitten class named name exists and contains no syntax error, a type-checked KittenClassType is returned. Otherwise, a type-checked fictitious KittenClassType is returned, whose code contains no fields, nor constructors nor methods.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the name of the file of the class, including the .kit termination
        Returns:
        the unique Kitten class type object for the (type-checked) class with the given name

      • getAll

        public static final java.util.Collection<ClassType> getAll()
        Yields ClassType's that have been created so far.
        Returns:
        the types

      • typeCheck

        public void typeCheck()
        Type-checks this class type, i.e., its abstract syntax.

      • translate

        public Program translate()
        Translates this class into intermediate Kitten code. It is assumed that this class has been already type-checked.
        Returns:
        the program reachable from the empty constructor or the main of this class, translated into Kitten code

             throws java.io.IOException
